mastering.cancelMsg: Are you sure you want to cancel mastering and lose all calibrated data?
mastering.cancelWarm: Cannot go to first wizard because reset original failed.
mastering.previousWarm: Cannot go to previous because reset original failed.
mastering.leaveMsg: Are you sure you want to leave this page and lose all calibrated data?
mastering.selectJointH: This mastering will get back to the previously saved offset.
mastering.pickJoints: Pick the joint/joints you want to calibrate.
mastering.emjsh1: This mastering will set J2's offset to the actual mechanical offset.
mastering.emjsh2: Make sure all joints have been mastered by basic master.
mastering.bmjsh: Make sure the joint/joints to be mastered are at zero pulse point
mastering.bmjsh2: Jog the robot into the near point of the marked point.
mastering.bmjsh3: Move the robot to the reference point by command
mastering.pulsePositionContent1: position aligned with Y-axis in Robot coordinate system
mastering.pulsePositionContent2: position where Arms #1 and #2 are in a straight line (Regardless of the Joint #1 direction)
mastering.pulsePositionContent3: upper limit position in motion range
mastering.pulsePositionContent4: position where the flat surface (or groove in the up/down mechanical stop) on the shaft faces forward the tip of Arm #2
mastering.emj2sh: Jog the robot to the reference point.
mastering.emj2sh2: Move the robot to the reference point with inverse pose by command.
mastering.emj2sh3: Jog the robot exactly to the reference point
mastering.complexJogTip: If you have more complex situation, go to terminal window to move the robot in the upper-right corner.
mastering.ajsh: Jog the robot accurately to the reference point.
mastering.congratulationsContent2: Successful. Move the robot to existent points to verify.

The calculation error exceeds the allowed 5mm limit.
Using this tool data can lead to undesirable behavior.

tour.title: Getting Started
tour.content: In this demo, we will load and run your first program. Click the NEXT button to continue.

tour.title: Project Editor
tour.content: Click on Project Editor (the highlighted button) in the main menu to open the Project Editor screen.

tour.title: Menu Collapse
tour.content: To save screen space, click the MENU EXPAND/COLLAPSE button in the app's toolbar.

tour.title: Project Editor
tour.content: In this demo we will go through the basic elements of the Project editor.

tour.title: This is the Project Tree
tour.content: The Project Tree contains all the programs, libraries, data and configuration files for your project.

tour.title: Apps
tour.content: A project can contain many applications, listed under the "Apps" folder.

tour.title: App Structure
tour.content: Each app has a PROGRAM file, a DATA file, and LIBRARY files.

tour.title: Program Editor
tour.content: This is where you'll write your code. softMC applications are written in the MC-Basic language.

tour.title: Loading an App
tour.content: When you're done writing your code, use the SAVE & LOAD button to save your code and then load it to the controller.

tour.title: App Status
tour.content: Once the app is loaded, its status would change to READY.

tour.title: Running the app
tour.content: To run the app, click on the RUN button and the app will start running.

tour.title: Note #1
tour.content: While an app is loaded, you CAN'T edit it (notice how the editor is greyed out).

tour.title: Note #2
tour.content: You can monitor the progress of the app by looking at the green lines in the editor.

tour.title: 3D Preview
tour.content: You can use the mouse's left and right buttons to rotate/pan the 3D view. Use the WHEEL button to zoom in/out.

tour.title: Toggle 3D Preview
tour.content: You can use this toggle button to show/hide the 3D simulator window.

tour.title: Demo Completed!
tour.content:
Well done! You just ran your first MC-Basic program!

To learn even more, visit the HELP screen (located at the bottom of the main menu).

trivia: You can record the robot's motion by pressing the RECORD button on the main app toolbar.
You can add a new application to the project by right clicking the Apps folder.
You can EXPAND or COLLAPSE the application's toolbar by clicking on the arrow button in the app toolbar.
You can CLEAR all commands from the terminal by using the command CLEAR in the terminal.
You can UPLOAD a new PROFILE PICTURE by expanding the app's side menu, clicking the profile picture, and choosing a photo.
